duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and execute cybersecurity specifications such as Risk Management Framework (RMF), DIACAP, STIGs, and other government security specifications and guidelines.
Contribute to the achievement of business objectives by recognizing and incorporating various security designs and lessons learned.
Report relevant cyber systems engineering design and communicate issues, impacts, and corrective actions that affect the cyber design and implementation.
Lead security work groups, serve as a consultant to senior management and customers on long-range security planning and security issues.

Serve as a company technical spokesperson in cyber security, and have frequent contact with project leaders, customer program leadership, and professionals within the Engineering department and project teams.
Apply basic project leadership principles including SPI/CPI, Earned Value, Cost Account Management (CAM), and Statistical Process Controls.
Obtain a Secret Clearance and recognize and apply basic project leadership principles.
Be a creative thinker and good multi-tasker.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, or a related Science or Mathematics field (Master's degree preferred)
